questions.question: What does it mean when we say Allah is Al-Khaliq?
choices: Allah is the One who provides food only
Allah is the Creator of everything
Allah is an angel who writes deeds
Allah is only the creator of humans
questions.explanation: Al-Khaliq means The Creator—Allah created everything, not just humans.

questions.question: Which statement best fits Islamic belief about why we exist?
choices: To become famous and leave a legacy
To enjoy life with no rules
To worship Allah and live with purpose
To follow whatever society says is right
questions.explanation: Islam teaches we were created to worship Allah and live a meaningful life guided by Him.

questions.question: Which is the strongest everyday sign that things don’t happen by pure accident?
choices: A random scribble on paper
A detailed phone app with many features
A broken chair
A messy room
questions.explanation: Complex design points to intelligence and planning—like an app needing a developer.

questions.question: In Islam, what is 'fitrah'?
choices: A special kind of charity
A natural sense that Allah is real and truth exists
A rule about fasting
A type of prayer
questions.explanation: Fitrah is the natural disposition Allah placed in us—recognizing truth and the Creator.

questions.question: If someone says, “I only pray when people are watching,” what’s the main issue?
choices: They are praying too fast
They are doing riya’ (showing off in worship)
They are praying at the wrong time
They should pray only at home
questions.explanation: Riya’ is showing off—worship is for Allah, not for people’s approval.

questions.question: Which is the BEST way to build sincerity in worship?
choices: Think about what people will say about you
Hide every good deed so nobody knows
Remind yourself: “Allah sees me and I’m doing this for Him”
Only worship when you feel motivated
questions.explanation: Sincerity grows when you focus on Allah’s awareness and your intention (niyyah).

questions.question: Which phrase best describes Tawheed?
choices: Believing Allah has partners who help Him
Believing only Allah deserves worship
Believing angels control the universe
Believing you can worship anything as long as you are sincere
questions.explanation: Tawheed is the oneness of Allah—He alone deserves worship and has no partners.

questions.question: Which action matches the idea of living with purpose?
choices: Following trends even if they conflict with Islam
Making choices that please Allah—even when it’s hard
Only caring about grades and money
Avoiding all challenges and responsibility
questions.explanation: Purpose means aligning your choices with Allah’s guidance, not just convenience or trends.

questions.question: What is the most accurate Islamic view of Allah’s knowledge?
choices: Allah knows some things, but not everything
Allah only knows what happens in the future
Allah knows everything—seen and unseen
Allah learns new information over time
questions.explanation: Allah is Al-‘Aleem: His knowledge is complete and perfect.

questions.question: What should you do BEFORE you start praying to check your intention?
choices: Check your phone notifications
Pause and ask: “Am I doing this because Allah commanded it, for Allah?”
Make sure someone is watching
Wait until you feel like it
questions.explanation: A quick intention check helps protect sincerity and reminds you worship is for Allah.
